subnarratives.name: Unbuilt
subnarratives.short-desc: Conceptual projects that were never constructed.
subnarratives.description:
Unbuilt projects represent visionary ideas that remained theoretical. Examples include:

  • Walking City (Archigram): Mobile, self-sustaining cities.
  • Continuous Monument (Superstudio): A dystopian megastructure wrapping the Earth.
  • Hyperloop Stations: Futuristic high-speed transit hubs.
  • The Line (Saudi Arabia): A 170km-long linear city.

subnarratives.name: Built
subnarratives.description:
Built projects demonstrate architectural execution. Examples include:

  • Nakagin Capsule Tower (Japan): Modular housing experiment.
  • Kowloon Walled City (Hong Kong): Hyper-dense urban block.
  • Arcosanti (USA): Sustainable desert city.
  • Wrapped Reichstag (Germany): Art-wrapped parliament building.

subnarratives.name: Europe
subnarratives.description:
European projects span historical and futuristic visions:

  • Plan Voisin (France): Le Corbusier's radical skyscraper plan for Paris.
  • No-Stop City (Italy): Boundless urban grid challenging consumerism.
  • Futuro House (Finland): UFO-shaped modular homes.

subnarratives.name: Asia
subnarratives.description:
Asian projects blend tradition and innovation:

  • Nakagin Capsule Tower (Japan): Metabolist modular architecture.
  • Kowloon Walled City (Hong Kong): Organic, unregulated urban growth.
  • The Line (Saudi Arabia): Futuristic linear desert city.

subnarratives.name: America
subnarratives.description:
American projects emphasize experimentation:

  • Torre David (Venezuela): Vertical slum in an abandoned skyscraper.
  • Arcosanti (USA): Paolo Soleri's ecological city.
  • Roden Crater (USA): James Turrell's light observatory.

subnarratives.name: Global
subnarratives.short-desc: Projects with global or virtual scope.
subnarratives.description:
Global/virtual projects transcend geography:

  • Freedom Ship: Floating sovereign city.
  • Metaverse Urbanism: Digital cities in virtual space.
  • Terraforming Mars: Planetary-scale habitats.

subnarratives.name: Before 2000
subnarratives.short-desc: Projects conceived or built pre-21st century.
subnarratives.description:
Pre-2000 projects reflect 20th-century ideals:

  • Walking City (1964): Mobile urban units.
  • Continuous Monument (1969): Critique of modernism.
  • Building Cuts (1970s): Deconstructed architecture.

subnarratives.name: After 2000
subnarratives.description:
Post-2000 projects embrace technology:

  • Hyperloop Stations: High-speed vacuum transit.
  • AI-Designed Cities: Algorithmic urban planning.
  • Metaverse Urbanism: Virtual decentralized spaces.

subnarratives.name: Urbanism
subnarratives.short-desc: Projects addressing urban planning and design.
subnarratives.description:
Urbanism-focused projects reimagine cityscapes:

  • Plan Voisin: Demolition-based modernist grid.
  • Arcosanti: Eco-integrated desert city.
  • The Line: Car-free linear desert metropolis.

subnarratives.name: Radical Living
subnarratives.description:
Radical living projects challenge norms:

  • Nakagin Capsule Tower: Replaceable micro-apartments.
  • Kowloon Walled City: Lawless hyper-density.
  • Torre David: Informal vertical community.

subnarratives.name: Artistic Intervention
subnarratives.description:
Artistic projects redefine space:

  • Wrapped Reichstag: Parliament building in fabric.
  • Building Cuts: Sliced-open structures.
  • Neon Installations: Light-transformed urban spaces.

subnarratives.name: Tech Infrastructure
subnarratives.description:
Tech-driven infrastructure innovations:

  • Hyperloop Stations: Ultra-fast transit hubs.
  • LED News Ticker (BBC): Building-as-media-interface.
  • AI-Designed Cities: Algorithm-optimized layouts.

subnarratives.name: Futuristic Utopias
subnarratives.description:
Utopian projects imagine better futures:

  • Walking City: Nomadic urban units.
  • No-Stop City: Limitless anti-hierarchy grid.
  • Terraforming Mars: Extraterrestrial habitats.

subnarratives.name: Urban Dystopias
subnarratives.description:
Dystopian projects warn of urban excess:

  • Continuous Monument: Homogenizing global grid.
  • Plan Voisin: Historic erasure for efficiency.
  • Kowloon Walled City: Chaos as order.

subnarratives.name: Innovation
subnarratives.description:
Innovative projects break new ground:

  • Nakagin Capsule Tower: Modular metabolism.
  • LED News Ticker: Architecture as media.
  • Metaverse Urbanism: Digital placemaking.

subnarratives.name: Spatial Deconstruction
subnarratives.description:
Deconstructive projects challenge form:

  • Building Cuts: Exposing hidden layers.
  • Wrapped Reichstag: Transforming perception.
  • Roden Crater: Celestial light observatory.

subnarratives.name: In Theory
subnarratives.description:
Theoretical projects exist as ideas:

  • Walking City: Mobile urban theory.
  • AI-Designed Cities: Computational urbanism.
  • Freedom Ship: Floating tax-free nation.

subnarratives.name: In Practice
subnarratives.description:
Practical projects achieved physical form:

  • Nakagin Capsule Tower: Built metabolist experiment.
  • Arcosanti: Ongoing eco-city.
  • Kowloon Walled City: Organic urban growth.
